Project Structure

PhilJS projects follow a conventional file structure that enables file-based routing, code organization, and optimal bundling.

Standard Project Structure

my-philjs-app/
├── src/
│   ├── app/                    # Application routes (file-based routing)
│   │   ├── layout.tsx          # Root layout (wraps all pages)
│   │   ├── page.tsx            # Home page (/)
│   │   ├── loading.tsx         # Loading UI
│   │   ├── error.tsx           # Error boundary
│   │   ├── about/
│   │   │   └── page.tsx        # About page (/about)
│   │   ├── blog/
│   │   │   ├── layout.tsx      # Blog layout
│   │   │   ├── page.tsx        # Blog index (/blog)
│   │   │   └── [slug]/
│   │   │       └── page.tsx    # Blog post (/blog/:slug)
│   │   └── api/
│   │       └── users/
│   │           └── route.ts    # API route (/api/users)
│   ├── components/             # Reusable UI components
│   │   ├── ui/                 # Base UI components
│   │   │   ├── Button.tsx
│   │   │   ├── Input.tsx
│   │   │   └── Card.tsx
│   │   ├── layout/             # Layout components
│   │   │   ├── Header.tsx
│   │   │   ├── Footer.tsx
│   │   │   └── Sidebar.tsx
│   │   └── features/           # Feature-specific components
│   │       ├── auth/
│   │       └── blog/
│   ├── lib/                    # Shared utilities
│   │   ├── api.ts              # API client
│   │   ├── utils.ts            # Helper functions
│   │   └── constants.ts        # App constants
│   ├── hooks/                  # Custom hooks
│   │   ├── useAuth.ts
│   │   └── useMediaQuery.ts
│   ├── stores/                 # Global state stores
│   │   ├── auth.ts
│   │   └── theme.ts
│   ├── types/                  # TypeScript type definitions
│   │   └── index.ts
│   ├── styles/                 # Global styles
│   │   ├── globals.css
│   │   └── variables.css
│   └── main.tsx                # Application entry point
├── public/                     # Static assets
│   ├── favicon.ico
│   ├── robots.txt
│   └── images/
├── tests/                      # Test files
│   ├── unit/
│   └── e2e/
├── package.json
├── tsconfig.json
├── vite.config.ts
├── tailwind.config.ts          # If using Tailwind
└── philjs.config.ts            # PhilJS configuration

The app/ Directory

The app/ directory uses file-based routing. Each folder represents a route segment, and special files define the behavior of that route.

Special Files

FilePurpose
page.tsxDefines the UI for a route (required for route to be accessible)
layout.tsxShared layout that wraps child routes
loading.tsxLoading UI shown while page content loads
error.tsxError boundary for the route segment
not-found.tsxUI shown when a route is not found
route.tsAPI endpoint (server-only)

Dynamic Routes

app/
├── blog/
│   ├── page.tsx                # /blog
│   └── [slug]/
│       └── page.tsx            # /blog/:slug (dynamic)
├── users/
│   └── [...id]/
│       └── page.tsx            # /users/* (catch-all)
└── shop/
    └── [[...categories]]/
        └── page.tsx            # /shop or /shop/* (optional catch-all)

Route Groups

Use parentheses to create route groups that don't affect the URL:

app/
├── (marketing)/                # Group for marketing pages
│   ├── about/
│   │   └── page.tsx           # /about
│   └── contact/
│       └── page.tsx           # /contact
├── (shop)/                     # Group for shop pages
│   ├── layout.tsx             # Shared shop layout
│   ├── products/
│   │   └── page.tsx           # /products
│   └── cart/
│       └── page.tsx           # /cart
└── (auth)/                     # Group for auth pages
    ├── layout.tsx             # Auth-specific layout
    ├── login/
    │   └── page.tsx           # /login
    └── register/
        └── page.tsx           # /register

The components/ Directory

Organize your components by type and feature:

components/
├── ui/                        # Primitive/base components
│   ├── Button/
│   │   ├── Button.tsx
│   │   ├── Button.test.tsx
│   │   └── index.ts
│   ├── Input/
│   ├── Card/
│   └── index.ts               # Barrel export
├── layout/                    # Layout components
│   ├── Header/
│   ├── Footer/
│   └── Sidebar/
├── forms/                     # Form components
│   ├── LoginForm/
│   └── ContactForm/
└── features/                  # Feature-specific components
    ├── auth/
    │   ├── LoginButton.tsx
    │   └── UserMenu.tsx
    └── blog/
        ├── PostCard.tsx
        └── CommentSection.tsx

Configuration Files

philjs.config.ts

philjs.config.tstypescript
1import { defineConfig } from 'philjs';
2 
3export default defineConfig({
4  // Build configuration
5  build: {
6    // Output directory
7    outDir: 'dist',
8    // Enable/disable SSR
9    ssr: true,
10    // Islands mode for partial hydration
11    islands: false,
12  },
13 
14  // Server configuration
15  server: {
16    port: 3000,
17    host: 'localhost',
18  },
19 
20  // Router configuration
21  router: {
22    // Base path for all routes
23    basePath: '',
24    // Trailing slash behavior
25    trailingSlash: false,
26  },
27 
28  // Plugins
29  plugins: [
30    // Add plugins here
31  ],
32});

vite.config.ts

vite.config.tstypescript
1import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
2import philjs from 'philjs-compiler/vite';
3import path from 'path';
4 
5export default defineConfig({
6  plugins: [
7    philjs({
8      jsx: true,
9      ssr: true,
10    }),
11  ],
12 
13  resolve: {
14    alias: {
15      '@': path.resolve(__dirname, './src'),
16      '@/components': path.resolve(__dirname, './src/components'),
17      '@/lib': path.resolve(__dirname, './src/lib'),
18    },
19  },
20 
21  build: {
22    target: 'esnext',
23    minify: 'terser',
24  },
25});

Rust Project Structure

Rust projects follow a similar structure but with Cargo conventions:

my-philjs-rust-app/
├── src/
│   ├── lib.rs                  # Library root
│   ├── app.rs                  # App component
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── mod.rs
│   │   ├── header.rs
│   │   └── footer.rs
│   ├── routes/
│   │   ├── mod.rs
│   │   ├── home.rs
│   │   └── about.rs
│   ├── server/                 # Server-only code
│   │   ├── mod.rs
│   │   ├── api.rs
│   │   └── db.rs
│   └── types/
│       └── mod.rs
├── public/
│   └── index.html
├── Cargo.toml
├── PhilJS.toml                 # PhilJS configuration
└── README.md

Best Practices

  • Colocation: Keep related files together (component, styles, tests)
  • Barrel exports: Use index.ts files for cleaner imports
  • Feature folders: Group code by feature rather than type for larger apps
  • Type safety: Define types in a central location for reuse
  • Environment separation: Use .env files for environment-specific config
